title: Calories in Cocoa Powder
meta_description: Discover calories in cocoa powder per 100g, including carbs, protein, fiber, fat breakdown, and preparation tweaks for your recipes.
assumptions: Unsweetened, natural cocoa powder (non-alkalized); dry, sifted; no added sugars or fats.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, processing (natural vs. Dutch), and moisture content. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: 100g of unsweetened cocoa powder contains about 228 kcal and 20g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Mix with 1 tsp oil for baking (per 100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tablespoon of cocoa powder?
faqs.a: About 12 kcal per tablespoon (5g) of unsweetened cocoa powder.

faqs.q: Is cocoa powder high in fiber?
faqs.a: Yes, 100g provides ~33g fiber, mostly insoluble for digestive health.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in cocoa powder?
faqs.a: Around 20g protein per 100g, making it a good plant-based source.

faqs.q: Does Dutch-processed cocoa have more calories?
faqs.a: Slightly, about 10-20 kcal more per 100g due to processing, but similar macros.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in unsweetened cocoa powder?
faqs.a: Yes, ~58g per 100g, but mostly fiber with low net carbs (~25g).
